== Personal life ==
== Personal life ==

Twiggy married American actor [[Michael Boner]] in 1977. They had a daughter, Carly, born in 1978. The marriage ended with his sudden death in 1983 from a [[myocardial infarction|heart attack]]. Twiggy met [[Leigh Lawson]] in 1984.<ref name="twigofficialsite" /> In 1988 they worked on the film ''[[Madame Sousatzka]]'', and married that year in [[Sag Harbor]], [[Long Island]]. Lawson adopted Twiggyâs daughter, Carly, who took on his surname. The couple resides in London,<ref>http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-1066965/Now-time-MY-swinging-sixties-How-getting-older-given-supermodel-Twiggy-new-lease-life.html</ref> and also own a home in Southwold, Suffolk.<ref>http://www.suffolktouristguide.com/Famous-Suffolk-People.asp</ref>
+
Twiggy married American actor [[Michael Witney]] in 1977. They had a daughter, Carly, born in 1978. The marriage ended with his sudden death in 1983 from a [[myocardial infarction|heart attack]]. Twiggy met [[Leigh Lawson]] in 1984.<ref name="twigofficialsite" /> In 1988 they worked on the film ''[[Madame Sousatzka]]'', and married that year in [[Sag Harbor]], [[Long Island]]. Lawson adopted Twiggyâs daughter, Carly, who took on his surname. The couple resides in London,<ref>http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-1066965/Now-time-MY-swinging-sixties-How-getting-older-given-supermodel-Twiggy-new-lease-life.html</ref> and also own a home in Southwold, Suffolk.<ref>http://www.suffolktouristguide.com/Famous-Suffolk-People.asp</ref>
In her official site, she describes herself as being an ardent supporter of [[breast cancer]] research, [[animal welfare]], and [[anti-fur]] campaigns.<ref name="twigofficialsite" />
